channel.title: Diane Rehm: On My Mind
channel.description: Diane Rehm’s weekly podcast features newsmakers, writers, artists and thinkers on the issues she cares about most: what’s going on in Washington, ideas that inform, and the latest on living well as we live longer.
channel.copyright: Copyright WAMU 88.5 American University Radio - For Personal Use Only
channel.itunes:author: WAMU 88.5
channel.googleplay:author: WAMU 88.5
channel.itunes:keywords: Fans of the Diane Rehm Show can continue to listen to its trademark conversations with newsmakers, writers, artists and thinkers right here as Diane transitions this podcast to weekly episodes that we’ll be calling “On My Mind.”
channel.itunes:subtitle: Diane Rehm: On My Mind from WAMU 88.5 American University Radio
channel.itunes:summary: Diane Rehm’s weekly podcast features newsmakers, writers, artists and thinkers on the issues she cares about most: what’s going on in Washington, ideas that inform, and the latest on living well as we live longer.

item.title: Democratic Debates Tackle Age, Race And A Tilt To The Left
item.description: Democratic presidential hopefuls take the stage for two nights of debate. Winners, losers and what we learned about the state of the race.
item.itunes:author: Diane Rehm

item.title: A Debut Novel On The State Of Marriage – And Divorce
item.description: Taffy Brodesser-Akner, a writer for New York Times Magazine, has a new book called "Fleishman Is In Trouble."
item.itunes:author: Diane Rehm

item.title: The Crisis At The Border And What Can Be Done
item.description: President Trump is making immigration a central issue in his re-election campaign, just like he did in 2016. How should the Democratic candidates respond?
item.itunes:author: Diane Rehm

item.title: Historian David McCullough On Some Of America’s Earliest Westward Pioneers
item.description: The settlers of the Ohio territories brought idealistic values with them.
item.itunes:author: Diane Rehm

item.title: CNN’S Jim Acosta On The Dangers Of Trump’s Escalating Criticism Of The Media
item.description: CNN White House correspondent Jim Acosta on his clashes with Donald Trump, accusations of grandstanding and what it means when a president calls the media “the enemy of the people.”
item.itunes:author: Diane Rehm

item.title: On Fighting In A War That Has No Clear End
item.description: Elliot Ackerman served five tours in Iraq and Afghanistan. His new memoir is a reflection on his experiences, the region and a war that refuses to end.
item.itunes:author: Diane Rehm

item.title: The Consequences Of Trump’s Tariff Threats Against Mexico
item.description: What the president's threatened tariffs against Mexico say about state of U.S. trade and the future of the Trump economy.
item.itunes:author: Diane Rehm

item.title: America’s Urban-Rural Political Divide: Where It Came From And Why It Continues
item.description: The political divide between urban and rural America: why it is bad news for cities … and Democrats.
item.itunes:author: Diane Rehm

item.title: A Partisan Response To The Special Counsel’s Public Statement
item.description: What Robert Mueller said – and how this changes the politics surrounding impeachment.
item.itunes:author: Diane Rehm

item.title: How Many Is Too Many? A Look At The 2020 Democratic Field
item.description: The Democrats have a record number of candidates running for president. What the crowded field means for the party and its chances in 2020.
item.itunes:author: Diane Rehm
